entities: Economic Community Of West African States
summary:
* Providing support for the 2012 elections
* Conflict prevention and mitigation efforts
* Assisting the Government in tackling youth unemployment.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

* Calls on the Government of Sierra Leone to promote good governance, rule of law, and human rights, with assistance from UNIPSIL, including institutional reform, combating illicit drug trafficking, organized crime, and corruption.
* Urges the Government to increase efforts to combat corruption, improve accountability, and promote private sector development to generate wealth and employment opportunities.
* Requests the Government to support the Anti-Corruption Commission to increase transparency and management of natural resources and mitigate the risk of resource-based conflict.
* Encourages the Executive Representative of the Secretary-General to enhance integration and effectiveness of UN efforts on the ground.
* Calls on the Secretary-General to report on progress towards meeting benchmarks for the transition of UNIPSIL into a UN Country Team.
* Emphasizes the Government's primary responsibility for peacebuilding, security, and long-term development.
* Encourages the Peacebuilding Commission to provide support to the Government in preparation for the 2012 elections.
* Urges the Government to accelerate national unity and reconciliation.
* Commends the Government for recognizing the role of women in conflict prevention and resolution and encourages efforts to address sexual and gender-based violence.
* Requests the Secretary-General to report every six months on progress made in implementing the mandate of UNIPSIL.
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
